ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned various methods for digitally capturing items in museum collections- particularly cuneiform tablets.

I have no experience imaging artifacts for publication. Almost all of the skills I learned were new to me. These included RTI imaging (both the dome and highlight method), HDR photography, digital epigraphy, digital "unwrapping" of cylindrical objects, and 3D imaging.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course provided a thorough overview of the subject matter. However, the guidelines for the final projects were not always clear, and should be listed on the syllabus going forward.

This course could be improved if students could access equipment to practice these techniques more. While we practiced them all in class, it was not always possible to schedule more time to practice. Occasionally, we had homework projects in which we practiced the techniques, but these were not weekly. While this would increase the class burden on both professors and students, I think more frequent homework assignments would have improved my acquisition of these skills. However, I understand that the professors had many kinds of imaging to teach us and could not always spend much time on each one.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. If a student is willing to put in the work, this class offers a good introduction to skills that are marketable in the museum and cultural heritage space.
